item.title: 在礼来与诺和诺德肥胖症药物之争中，特朗普的价格谈判成为焦点
item.description: 在肥胖症药物巨头礼来公司和诺和诺德公司准备发布第三季度业绩之际，投资者们却把目光投向了别处：与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普进行的高风险价格谈判。【原文：As obesity drug heavyweights Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk gear up to release results for the third quarter, investors are looking elsewhere: high-stakes price talks with U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 尽管抵押贷款利率下降，美国 9 月成屋待售意外持平
item.description: 9 月份美国旧房购买合同出乎意料地保持不变，这可能是因为尽管抵押贷款利率下降，但对劳动力市场的担忧使潜在购房者保持观望。【原文：Contracts to purchase previously owned U.S. homes were unexpectedly unchanged in September, likely as worries about the labor market kept prospective buyers on the sidelines despite declining mortgage rates.】

item.title: 加拿大央行下调关键利率，暗示将结束减息政策
item.description: 加拿大央行周三将其关键隔夜利率降至 2.25%，一如市场普遍预期，并表示除非通胀和经济前景发生变化，否则这可能标志着其降息周期的结束。【原文：The Bank of Canada reduced its key overnight interest rate to 2.25% on Wednesday, as widely expected, and signaled this could mark an end to its cutting cycle unless the outlook for inflation and economy changed.】

item.title: 软件需求强劲，Fortive上调年度利润预期
item.description: Fortive 因其工业自动化软件技术需求强劲，第三季度销售额和利润超出预期，周三上调了全年利润预期，股价上涨约 10%。【原文：Fortive on Wednesday raised its annual profit forecast, after beating third-quarter sales and profit estimates on robust demand for its industrial automation software technology, sending its shares up about 10%.】

item.title: 墨西哥经济部：墨西哥和美国将继续谈判以达成贸易协议
item.description: 墨西哥经济部周三发表声明称，墨西哥经济部长马塞洛-埃布拉德（Marcelo Ebrard）会见了美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer），双方同意两国将继续就贸易协议进行谈判。【原文：Mexico's Economy Minister Marcelo Ebrard met with U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer and agreed both countries would continue negotiating toward a trade agreement, the Economy Ministry said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 查看 英伟达市值突破 5 万亿美元
item.description: 本周三，英伟达（Nvidia）市值突破 5 万亿美元，成为首家市值突破 5 万亿美元的公司，延续了其如日中天的崛起势头，牢牢占据了全球人工智能革命的核心位置。【原文：Nvidia on Wednesday became the first company to breach $5 trillion in market value, continuing a meteoric rise that has firmly positioned it at the heart of the global AI revolution.】

item.title: Garmin 上调年度利润展望；户外业务疲软拖累股价
item.description: 全球定位系统（GPS）设备制造商 Garmin 周三上调了今年的调整后利润预期，但报告称运营支出增加，户外和汽车部门的季度收入下降。【原文：GPS device maker Garmin on Wednesday raised its adjusted profit forecast for the year, but reported a rise in operating expenses and decline in quarterly revenue from its outdoor and auto units.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利将收购私人股票平台 EquityZen
item.description: 投资银行巨头摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）周三表示，它将收购私人股票平台 EquityZen，因为华尔街正在努力满足投资者对快速增长的初创企业股份日益增长的需求。【原文：Investment banking giant Morgan Stanley said on Wednesday it will buy private shares platform EquityZen, as Wall Street races to meet growing investor demand for stakes in fast‑growing startups.】

item.title: 洛克希德公司最新交易计划在海上无人机上搭载战斧导弹
item.description: 洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin）将向海上无人机制造商 Saildrone 投资 5000 万美元，以帮助其最大的侦察无人机配备导弹，这标志着这种远程自动舰船将首次搭载大威力导弹。【原文：Lockheed Martin is investing $50 million in sea drone maker Saildrone to help equip its biggest surveillance drones with missiles, marking the first time the long-distance autonomous ships will carry high-powered missiles aboard.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利前顾问起诉美国劳工部
item.description: 美国劳工部已被摩根士丹利前财务顾问起诉，指控其发布了该华尔街银行寻求的非法咨询意见，该意见可能会使数百起针对该银行的仲裁索赔泡汤。【原文：The U.S. Department of Labor has been sued by former Morgan Stanley financial advisers for allegedly issuing an illegal advisory opinion sought by the Wall Street bank that could scuttle hundreds of arbitration claims against the bank.】

item.title: 消息人士称，微软首席执行官萨蒂亚-纳德拉将于 12 月访问印度
item.description: 微软首席执行官萨蒂亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）将于12月前往印度，这是他今年第二次访问这个南亚国家，他计划在那里与政府高官举行会谈。【原文：Microsoft chief executive Satya Nadella is set to travel to India in December, his second visit to the South Asian country this year where he plans to hold meetings with top government officials, two sources with direct knowledge said.】

item.title: 铁路运营商 CSX 任命新首席财务官
item.description: CSX 周三任命凯文-布恩（Kevin Boone）为财务总监，接替已离职的肖恩-佩尔基（Sean Pelkey）。【原文：CSX on Wednesday named Kevin Boone as finance chief, succeeding Sean Pelkey, who has departed the railroad operator after about three years in the role.】

item.title: 21Shares 在加密货币的强劲诱惑下申请 Hype ETF
item.description: 21Shares周三向监管机构申请批准推出一款追踪Hype代币价格的被动交易所交易基金，一周前该公司同意被数字资产交易公司FalconX收购。【原文：21Shares on Wednesday filed for regulatory approval to launch a passive exchange-traded fund that would track the price of Hype token, a week after the company agreed to be acquired by digital assets trading firm FalconX.】

item.title: Verisk 下调 2025 年收入预期，低于华尔街预期
item.description: 数据分析公司 Verisk Analytics 周三下调了年度营收预期，低于华尔街预期，导致股价在盘前交易中下跌 8.7%。【原文：Data analytics firm Verisk Analytics cut its annual revenue forecast below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, sending shares down 8.7% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 私人信贷老板批评 First Brands 倒闭的 "错误信息
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）、黑石集团（Blackstone）和战神管理公司（Ares Management）的高管们周三表示，在美国公司 First Brands 和 Tricolor 破产时，他们没有接触过这两家公司，并指责将私人信贷与这两家公司的倒闭联系起来的错误信息。【原文：Apollo Global Management , Blackstone and Ares Management had no exposure to U.S. companies First Brands and Tricolor at the time of their bankrupcies, executives said on Wednesday, blaming misinformation for linking private credit to their collapse.】

item.title: 亚马逊启动人工智能基础设施项目，为 Anthropic 的 Claude 模型提供动力
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周三表示，它已启动了名为 "雷尼尔"（Rainier）的计算集群项目，并补充说，人工智能公司 Anthropic 将在今年年底前使用该基础设施的 100 多万个芯片。【原文：Amazon.com said on Wednesday it has launched its compute cluster project called Rainier, and added that artificial intelligence firm Anthropic will use more than a million chips of the infrastructure by the end of the year.】

item.title: 客户支出强劲，Cognizant 上调年度调整后利润预期
item.description: 认知技术公司（Cognizant Technology）周三上调了 2025 年全年调整后利润预期，预计企业客户希望利用人工智能升级数字基础设施的支出将激增。【原文：Cognizant Technology raised its full-year 2025 adjusted profit forecast on Wednesday, anticipating a surge in spending from enterprise clients looking to upgrade their digital infrastructure with artificial intelligence.】

item.title: Verizon 季度新增用户数和利润均超预期
item.description: 本周三，Verizon 的季度利润和新增无线用户数均超过华尔街预期，原因是围绕近期推出的 iPhone 开展的促销活动帮助这家美国无线服务提供商吸引了更多客户。【原文：Verizon beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and wireless subscriber additions on Wednesday, as promotions around the recent iPhone launches helped the U.S. wireless service provider attract more customers.】

item.title: 韩国公布与美国达成的贸易协议细节
item.description: 以下是在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示两国已达成贸易协议后不久，韩国首席政策顾问金容范（Kim Yong-beom）公布的一些细节。华盛顿尚未证实协议的细节。【原文：Following are some of the details released by South Korea's chief policy advisor Kim Yong-beom, shortly after U.S. President Donald Trump said the two nations had reached a trade deal. Washington has not confirmed the details of the agreement.】

item.title: 波音公司 777X 项目损失近 50 亿美元
item.description: 波音公司周三报告称，因777X喷气机项目延迟而产生了近50亿美元的费用，但由于商用飞机的生产和交付有所改善，其季度亏损有所收窄。【原文：Boeing reported a charge of nearly $5 billion related to delays in its 777X jet program on Wednesday, but its quarterly loss narrowed on improved production and deliveries of commercial aircraft.】

item.title: 美国第三季度需求强劲，通用电气医疗保健公司上调 2025 年利润预期
item.description: 通用电气医疗保健技术公司（GE HealthCare Technologies）周三上调了年度调整后利润预期，第三季度业绩超出预期，主要得益于美国及欧洲、中东和非洲地区对其医疗设备的强劲需求。【原文：GE HealthCare Technologies raised its annual adjusted profit forecast and beat estimates for third-quarter results on Wednesday, powered by strong demand for its medical devices in the United States and the Europe, Middle East, and Africa region.】

item.title: 早间竞价48 小时测试繁荣
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 增长放缓，Fiserv 下调年度盈利预期，股价下跌
item.description: Fiserv 周三连续第二个季度下调了年度盈利预期，并宣布对高级领导层进行大调整，因为这家支付公司正在努力应对增长放缓的问题，导致其股价在收盘前跳水 31%。【原文：Fiserv lowered its annual earnings forecasts for the second straight quarter on Wednesday and announced an overhaul of its senior leadership as the payments firm grapples with slowing growth, sending its shares diving 31% before the bell.】

item.title: 电梯制造商奥的斯因现代化订单增加，季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 本周三，电梯制造商奥的斯全球公司第三季度业绩超出华尔街预期，主要原因是现代化订单增长了 27%，支持了其服务部门的强劲增长。【原文：Elevator maker Otis Worldwide beat Wall Street estimates for the third quarter on Wednesday, driven by a 27% rise in modernization orders, which supported strong growth in its services segment.】

item.title: 礼来与沃尔玛首次推出减肥药零售提货选择
item.description: 礼来公司（Eli Lilly）周三表示，它将与沃尔玛合作，扩大礼来减肥药 Zepbound 的使用范围。【原文：Eli Lilly said on Wednesday it is partnering with Walmart to expand access to Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound, which will be offered for pick-up at Walmart pharmacies nationwide by mid-November.】

item.title: Etsy 任命内部人士 Kruti Goyal 为首席执行官，发布不乐观的第三季度财报
item.description: Etsy ETSY.N 周三任命内部人士 Kruti Goyal 为新任首席执行官，接替 Josh Silverman，并公布受需求放缓影响，核心销售额低于预期。【原文：Etsy ETSY.N named insider Kruti Goyal as its new chief executive officer on Wednesday, replacing Josh Silverman, and reported weaker-than-expected core sales, hurt by slowing demand.】

item.title: 需求持续低迷，卡夫亨氏下调年度销售额和利润预期
item.description: 卡夫亨氏（Kraft Heinz）周三下调了年度销售和利润预期，表明在宏观经济不确定的情况下，注重预算的消费者对其价格较高的零食和厨房调味品的需求持续疲软。【原文：Kraft Heinz lowered its annual sales and profit forecasts on Wednesday, signaling persistent weakness in demand for its pricier snacks and pantry condiments from budget-conscious consumers amid macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 行业组织称美国关键抵押贷款利率降至 13 个月低点
item.description: 上周，美国最受欢迎的住房贷款利率降至 13 个月以来的最低点，因为一项关键的通胀数据低于预期，从而巩固了美联储再次降息的预期。【原文：The interest rate on the most popular U.S. home loan dropped last week to a 13-month low after a key reading of inflation came in lower than expected, cementing expectations for another Federal Reserve interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 汇丰在新加坡扩建以初创企业为重点的部门，以此推动全球业务发展
item.description: 汇丰银行（HSBC）周三表示，该行已将创新银行业务扩展至新加坡，并承诺在新加坡拨款 15 亿美元，作为向初创公司提供贷款的全球行动的一部分。【原文：HSBC has expanded its innovation banking business to Singapore, pledging to allocate $1.5 billion in the city-state as part of a global push to lend to startup companies, the bank said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国发出信号，将在五年计划中取消对电动汽车的补贴
item.description: 中国已发出明确信号，表示愿意停止对电动汽车行业的补贴，因为多年来政府的大力支持助长了电动汽车行业的繁荣，使这个世界第二大经济体陷入严重供过于求的困境，并促使其进军全球汽车市场。【原文：China has sent a clear signal that it is willing to pull the plug on subsidies for its electric vehicle industry after years of big-ticket government support fuelled a boom that has left the world's second-largest economy saddled with vast oversupply, prompting it to push into global car markets.】
